brief_summary.textblock:
This study is a Phase I, open label study to determine the Maximum Tolerated Dose(MTD) and
      the Recommended Phase II Dose (RP2D) in patients with advanced solid tumors.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Investigate Safety, Pharmacokinetics (PK) and Pharmacodynamics (PD) of PQR309

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Histologically or cytologically confirmed diagnosis of advanced solid tumor for which
             no therapy of proven efficacy is available.

          -  Age ≥ 18

          -  Evidence of tumor progression with measurable or evaluable disease.

          -  Use of adequate contraceptive measures for male patients.

          -  Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) Performance Score of 0-1.

          -  Signed informed consent.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Concomitant anticancer therapy (e.g., chemotherapy, radiotherapy, hormonal,
             immunotherapy, biological response modifier, signal transduction inhibitors)

          -  Patients with a history of myocardial infarction or coronary artery bypass within the
             last 3 years.

          -  Patients with severe/unstable angina, coronary/peripheral arterial bypass,
             symptomatic congestive heart failure NYHA Class 3 or 4, hypertension BP>150/100mmHg.

          -  Pre-diagnosed diabetes mellitus.

          -  Fasting glucose > 7.0 mmol/L or HbA1c > 6%.

intervention.description: Dosing will be orally, once a day for the duration of the trial.

clinical_study.official_title: Phase I Study of Oral PQR309 in Patients With Advanced Solid Tumors

primary_outcome.measure: Maximum Tolerated Dose (MTD) and the Recommended Phase II Dose (RP2D)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of SAEs, incidence and severity of all AEs, changes of vital signs, physical examinations, body weight, changes of routine laboratory assessments.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
